policies.description: Perform Desktop Walkthrough exercises of the BCP for all Critical departments/functions annually
Perform Call Notification tests with confirmation of call acceptance and response time annually

Perform Components Test for all strategies annually, with an outcome of pass or fail assessed against...
Service Recovery Time Objective (SRTO) achieved where relevant
Access of all key systems and applications confirmed
Perform Crisis Management Plan Review annually
Crisis Management Discussion exercises (based scenarios) not less than once every 3 years in years where no simulation exercise is conducted

For ‘High Risk’ Third Parties (as defined in the Third Party Management Policy), not less than once every 3 years:
Conduct a Desktop walkthrough exercise with the Plan owner and Resilience team to review and sign off on the adequacy of the Third Party Contingency Plans (“TPCP”).
Coordinate a review of the external Third-Party Business Continuity and IT Disaster Recovery test results.

For ‘Medium Risk’ Third Parties, not less than once every 3 years must:
Attest on maintenance of external Third-Party Resilience capabilities to the Resilience team.
Ensure the standard approved build is deployed for servers and workstations.
Ensure that operating systems are licensed with vendor-support and not obsolete.
Ensure relevant patches are up to date, at least monthly.
Ensure that an Anti-virus program is installed with updates to both virus definitions and binaries and applied monthly in line with Group Standards.

Enable both Audit and Event Logging.
[Reference Security Logging & Monitoring Standard]
Disable media auto-run features.

Enable screen time-out and lock [15 minutes]
[Reference Access Control Management and Governance (ACMG) Standard Section 3.1d]
Disable automatic or anonymous logins

Ensure that administrator specific privileged user access accounts are created. No shared or generic accounts are allowed.
[Reference: Access Control Management & Governance Standard]

Apply password complexity for both user and privileged accounts as per Group ICS Standards.

[Reference: Access Control Management & Governance Standard]
Ensure an annual review of firewall rules is carried out and unsecure or unnecessary rules removed.

Ensure only encrypted USB storage devices are used for data transfers.
Note: Exceptions must be tracked, reviewed periodically and reported to appropriate country risk committee(s).

Not install, upload or download any content not related to the business purpose of the machine.
[For example: images, music files, software programs]
Only install Group approved Third Party software that is fully licensed and managed.

Ensure that Restricted and Confidential data is not stored on the machine at any point.
Note: The processing and transfer of data is acceptable as long as it meets the required standards.
Ensure a centralised inventory is managed and up to date.

Ensure that access reviews are carried out every six
(6)  months to ensure:
Only privileged accounts and unique user ID are used
2.   Only authorized users have a privileged account
Evidence of access reviews must be retained for Audit.

Carry out an annual review to ensure all Standalone Machines are identified and that they are still required and relevant.
Standalone Machines must also be classified to ensure that where high-risk Machines occur, all controls are applied.
Grant Approval for the usage of each Standalone for one year based on the Annual Review process.
